name: Improve your copy
description: Improve your copywriting, select from 5 options.

nodes.name: llm_1
nodes.title: Improve Your Copy Using LLMs
nodes.description: Answer a question using a large language model. Chat history can be used to maintain context between messages.

input_config.human_message:
You are the master of copywriting. You always use the following rules:
Rule 1: convey any message clearly and in plain English, so the reader doesn't have to think hard to understand it.
Rule 2: your copy is always simple, but very informative.
Rule 3: your copy is professional, but has a casual tone.
Rule 4. your copy uses common English words that a wide range of audiences can understand.
Improve this copy below, giving me 5 alternative options. Use this naming and use these rules:
Option 1 - small change: Keep most of the original copy. Only change words, expressions and their order if that's absolutely necessary to make the copy grammatically correct. If the copy is grammatically correct then just keep it as is. Here is an example: original copy: "Our new messaging seems to be welcome by the tech builders!". Better version for option 1: "Our new messaging seems to be welcomed by the tech builders"
Option 1 - shortened: Take the output of "Option 1 - small change", but shorten it as much as you can, in a way that you keep the essence of the content as well as the important logical details.
Option 2 - more change: Keep some of the original copy. You can change words, expressions and their order for better clarity and to better satisfy the rules and your personality above.
Option 3 - most change: Change most of the words expressions and their order in the original copy to better satisfy the rules and your personality above.
Option 4 - funny: Change most of the words expressions and their order in the original copy to better satisfy the rules and your personality above. In addition, use humour here, make the copy very funny.
Copy to improve: {{text}}

ui_metadata.value:
Unlike Nvidia’s traditional GPUs for gaming, Project Digits isn’t targeting consumers. Instead, it’s aimed at machine-learning researchers, smaller companies, and universities that want to develop advanced AI but don’t have billions of dollars to build massive data centers or buy enough cloud credits.

“There’s a gaping hole for data scientists and ML researchers and who are actively working, who are actively building something,” Huang said. “Maybe you don’t need a giant cluster. You’re just developing the early versions of the model, and you’re iterating constantly. You could do it in the cloud, but it just costs a lot more money.”

The supercomputer will cost about $3,000 when it hits the market in May, Nvidia said, and it will be available from the company itself as well as some of its manufacturing partners. Huang said Project Digits is a placeholder name, indicating it may change by the time the computer goes on sale.

“If you have a good name for it, reach out to us,” Huang said.
